cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles south of Tiburon, Haiti
cyclone.trajectory: moving north then north-northwest toward eastern Cuba, the Bahamas, and along the Florida east coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: possible coastal scrape/landfall along the east-central to northeast Florida coast (near Cape Canaveral–Jacksonville corridor)

weather_observation.watch_coast: No U.S. watches currently in effect (only Haiti, Cuba, Bahamas).
weather_observation.warning_coast: No U.S. warnings currently in effect (only Haiti, Cuba, Bahamas).
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast from Miami northward through Jacksonville and into Georgia and South Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm force winds (potentially gusts to hurricane force) possible Friday as Matthew passes just offshore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Elevated water levels of 3–5 ft possible along the St. Johns River mouth and adjacent coastline if the track hugs the coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall of 4–8 inches possible, creating flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and beach erosion likely to disrupt vessel traffic and port operations.
